text.div:
Generated Narrative: ImplementationGuide ihe.qrph.ccg

IHE_QRPH_CCG

The official URL for this implementation guide is: 

https://profiles.ihe.net/QRPH/CCG/ImplementationGuide/ihe.qrph.ccg

The IHE Computable Care Guidelines (CCG) Profile specifies a normative grammar and a normative transaction processing model that allows evidence-based care recommendations to be expressed in a way that a digital health solution can ingest and operationalize. This is an implementable and conformance-testable specification. It is targeted to regulated healthcare markets where the support for multiple conditions is an important requirement. The CCG Profile supports jurisdictions that want to leverage digital health to systemically improve the adoption of guideline-adherent best practices across an entire care delivery network.

name: IHE_QRPH_CCG
title: Computable Care Guidelines
description: The IHE Computable Care Guidelines (CCG) Profile specifies a normative grammar and a normative transaction processing model that allows evidence-based care recommendations to be expressed in a way that a digital health solution can ingest and operationalize. This is an implementable and conformance-testable specification. It is targeted to regulated healthcare markets where the support for multiple conditions is an important requirement. The CCG Profile supports jurisdictions that want to leverage digital health to systemically improve the adoption of guideline-adherent best practices across an entire care delivery network.

resource.name: CCG CARD Digital Signature
resource.description: This is a profile on the FHIR Provenance resource to align with CCG requirements for signature

resource.name: CCG CARD Folder PlanDefinition
resource.description: Each unique CCG will be expressed as a PlanDefinition (a CCG Folder) that lists the CCG's defined CARDs

resource.name: CCG CARD type - Administer Medication
resource.description: The role of this type of CCG CARD is to record a medication administration for the patient.

resource.name: CCG CARD type - Collect Information
resource.description: The role of this type of CCG CARD is to collect information about the patient.

resource.name: CCG CARD type - Dispense Medication
resource.description: The role of this type of CCG CARD is to create a medication dispensation for the patient.

resource.name: CCG CARD type - Order Medication
resource.description: The role of this type of CCG CARD is to create a prescription / medication order for the patient.

resource.name: CCG CARD type - Propose a Diagnosis
resource.description: The role of this type of CCG CARD is to propose a diagnosis of health conditions; it content about the patient.

resource.name: CCG CARD type - Provide Information
resource.description: The role of this type of CCG CARD is to provide information, counselling, or instructions to the patient.

resource.name: CCG CARD type - Request a Service (Lab Order)
resource.description: The role of this type of CCG CARD is to create a laboratory / pathology ServiceRequest for the patient.

resource.name: CCG CARD type - Request a Service (Procedure Order)
resource.description: The role of this type of CCG CARD is to create a procedure ServiceRequest for the patient.

resource.name: CCG CARD type - Request a Service (Radiology Order)
resource.description: The role of this type of CCG CARD is to create a laboratory / pathology ServiceRequest for the patient.

resource.name: CCG CARD type - Request a Service (Referral)
resource.description: The role of this type of CCG CARD is to create a procedure ServiceRequest for the patient.

resource.name: CCG CARD type - Request Immunization
resource.description: The role of this type of CCG CARD is to recommend and record an immunization event for the patient. Importantly, this CARD does not create an order for a future planned immunization.

resource.name: CCG CARD type - Stop Activity (Medication Order)
resource.description: The role of this type of CCG CARD is to create a Task that, upon being processed, will “stop” a patient’s presently active MedicationRequest (i.e. set status to stopped).

resource.name: CCG CARD type - Stop Activity (Service Order)
resource.description: The role of this type of CCG CARD is to create a Task that, upon being processed, will “stop” a patient's presently active ServiceRequest (i.e. set status to revoked).

resource.name: CCG Data In Bundle
resource.description:
CCG Data Input Bundle. 
A container for a collection of resources that is passed as part of the Apply Guideline transaction submission. This bundle represents the content that will be used by the Guideline Engine to evaluate all relevant CCG CARD&s condition statements during the $apply operation.

resource.name: CCG Data-In Bundle Encounter
resource.description: Identifies the Encounter to which the CCG Apply Guideline transaction is relevant.

resource.name: CCG Data-In Bundle IPS CarePlan Specific Resource
resource.description: This is a CarePlan profile that forces at least one of the activity.definitionCanonical to be a CARD Folder

resource.name: CCG Data-In Bundle IPS Composition Resource
resource.description: IPS Composition Resource Profiled for use with CCG

resource.name: CCG Data-In Bundle Location
resource.description: Location of the Encounter in the Data-in Bundle

resource.name: CCG Data-In Bundle Organization
resource.description: Organization relevant to the current Encounter

resource.name: CCG Data-In Bundle Practitioner
resource.description: Identifies the Practitioner initiating the CCG Apply Guideline transaction

resource.name: CCG Data-In Bundle PractitionerRole
resource.description: Role of the Practitioner in the Data-in Bundle

resource.name: CCG Deployment Package (IG)
resource.description: The deployment model is that each unique CCG Folder and its contents will be contained in a FHIR package.

resource.name: CCG Folder 1
resource.description: Example CCG Folder - e.g. Diabetes

resource.name: CCG Folder 2
resource.description: Example CCG Folder - e.g. Hypertension

resource.name: CCG IPS Bundle
resource.description: This bundle follows the IPS Bundle with the exception of using the CCG Composition

resource.name: CCG Library for CARDs
resource.description: Profile to serve as the basis for all CARD definitions referencing Library resources based on the CPG CQL Library

resource.name: CCG Patient Plans (patient-specific) PlanDefinition
resource.description: A patient-specific PlanDefinition holds the list of one or more applicable CCG Folders.

resource.name: Code System for All CCG Card Types
resource.description: This CodeSystem defines all known CardTypes for use in CARD PlanDefinitions

resource.name: Data-in Care Plan
resource.description: Example CarePlan resource including a patient-speicific PlanDefinition (to reference applicable CCG Folders).

resource.name: Data-in Encounter
resource.description: Example in-progress outpatient encounter of normal priority

resource.name: Data-in Location
resource.description: Example Location (Standalone Primary Care Clinic)

resource.name: Data-in Organization
resource.description: Example organization providing family care services

resource.name: Data-in Patient
resource.description: Example patient to which all the Data-in example content relates

resource.name: Data-in PlanDefinition for Patient CCGs
resource.description: An example person-centric PlanDefinition resource referencing applicable CCG Folders.

resource.name: Data-in Practitioner
resource.description: Example practitioner (Family Doctor)

resource.name: Data-in PractitionerRole
resource.description: Example practitionerRole (Family Doctor in a Family Practice setting)

resource.name: Guideline Engine
resource.description: IHE QRPH Computable Care Guidelines (CCG) - Guideline Engine.

resource.name: Guideline Performer
resource.description: IHE QRPH Computable Care Guidelines (CCG) - Guideline Performer.
